comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19176,11 +19176,14 @@ charismanews.com#$##headerAreaWrap { height: 180px !important; }
 !
 ! check-host.net
 ! Make sure that https://check-host.net/about/api is not broken
-/^https:\/\/check-host\.net\/images\/[a-z]+-(en|ru)\.png$/$domain=check-host.net
-check-host.net##div[class*="-f"]:has(> * > img[src*=".svg"])
-check-host.net#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie', 'closet_advertisments', 'privatealps,alexhost,pp-liaryt2,pp-liaryt,u1host-rep,waic-b')
-check-host.net###amain > div:has(a[href*="pq.hosting"])
-||check-host.net/images/*.png?
+check-host.net#?#[class] > [src*=".svg"]:upward(2)
comment.body: I tried using `:has()` at first, but I changed it to `:upward()` as I was having some problems with false positives. The goal of the rule was to not rely on class names other than `.svg`

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
English version: 

Funny thing. Outbrain is usually blocked, but I have to log in there for professional reasons. However, even though I add custom rules (@@||www.outbrain.com^$important
@@||outbrain.com^$important
@@||my.outbrain.com^$important), I am still unable to log in and always get the ERR_ADDRESS_INVALID browser message. Any idea what I should add to the rules so that Adguard will let me get there?

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.themoviedb.org falsely blocked by Adguard QUIC DNS upstream
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard DNS ### AdGuard version quic://dns.adguard-dns.com ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? www.themoviedb.org ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I'm using Adguard Home with Adguard QUIC (other protocols untested) DNS upstream configured. It returns `127.0.0.1` as an answer for `www.themoviedb.org`. As I understand, this is commonly used for blocking. However, I couldn't find it in your filterlists, besides the [allow rule](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/bc4da839f3cbccbb786c94fe0dfa6b920fef3a2d/BaseFilter/sections/allowlist_stealth.txt#L364) for unbreaking. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
As it's impossible not to include a blocklist I'm using, I chose AdGuard Base filter, but this is irrelevant because the upstream's response is itself `127.0.0.1`. I may be incorrect. ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition
